reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Global Train & Equip Kenya - RAVEN Unmanned Aerial System (UAS). Global Train & Equip Kenya - Intelligence Company (FY15 CTPF). Global Train & Equip Kenya - Ranger Regiment (FY15 CTPF). Global Train & Equip Kenya - CIED Enhancement (2282 T2). Global Train & Equip Kenya - Ranger Regiment Assistance. Global Train & Equip Kenya - Scan Eagle ISR System. Global Train & Euip Kenya - Engineer Company (FY15 CTPF)

description.narrative: This award strives to help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability. More specifically, this includes This program provides the KDF with RAVEN UAS to expand their capacity to conduct counterterrorism border security operations.. This program will provide communications articles and operational services on military intelligence and network analysis, enhancing the Kenyan militarys ability to target terrorists operating within Kenya in addition to supporting AMISOM operations.. This program continues the development of Kenyan SOF by establishing an organic support and transportation element within the KRR to provide combat services and support of SOF forces deployed to AMISOM. (Requires DTSA waiver). This program will provide the KDF with a C-IED capability to bolster effectiveness and reduce risk to Kenyan forces deployed in support of AMISOM. This program requires a DTSA waiver for NVGs.. This program funds equipment, training and small-scale military construction for the Kenyan Ranger Regiment (KRR), Kenya's premier military CT element, with the intent of enhancing the unit's capabilities and capacity to combat regional threats.. Provides KDF with Scan Eagle to increase ability to detect/monitor al-Shabaab. Builds layered ISR capability by providing a medium-range system and enhances Kenya's ISR concept of operations as it continues to support African Union Mission in Somalia. This program will provide an initial capability to address gaps in maneuverability and route clearance capabilities..

To help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability; and for responding effectively against arising threats to national or international security and stability.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: In the last few years, Kenya has embarked on a comprehensive and ambitious democratic reform process, including the devolution of government structures and authorities. The goal of devolution is to facilitate a more accountable and participatory system of governance that will allow for broader-based economic growth and improved service delivery at the local level. U.S. assistance in Kenya works across sectors to support this process with an overarching goal of sustainably strengthening regional peace, prosperity and security. These sectors include democracy, human rights and governance; elections in 2017; health including quality and accessibility, infectious diseases, child and maternal health, and water and sanitation; agriculture; private sector competitiveness; education and youth; and environment including biodiversity, adaptation for climate change and combating wildlife trafficking. In addition to participating in several Presidential Initiatives, Kenya is a Relief-to-Development Transition (R2DT) Focus Country and receives assistance to promote resilience and climate adaptation in drought-prone areas.

title.narrative: U.S. General Services Administration Federal Government
